title: Grade 5
subject: Extended Content Standards For English Language Arts (2017-)

document.title: North Carolina EXTENDED CONTENT STANDARDS English Language Arts K-12

F3D265B3A0D9492B9441D8A57539A8D1.description: Use words acquired through conversations, being read to, and during shared reading activities including domain-specific words.

714AC75552AE43668550567844922BD9.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.6 – Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for
reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in developing vocabulary
knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

A3818ABBD3E94FC98624AB0501A9E2DC.description: Use simple, common idioms (e.g., You bet! It’s a deal., cool.).

20465C4AA15646B8A359DEE851B9FC1A.description: Demonstrate understanding of words that have similar meanings.

C0FEF493E3E747B69646A23FCCECD69A.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and use.

B02218FE58A844E3ABDE6EA42D44D661.description: CCR Anchor Standard L.5 – Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and nuances in word meanings.

A962F3100AAE4D8FB7C4CE2E744414A8.description: Demonstrate knowledge of word meanings drawn from grade 5 content.

93AF69AF63A047849ADC5A9BC4F50EE3.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.4 – Determine and clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context
clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

C035BCA253D342B59F8A02D568DE9B01.description: Use language to achieve desired meaning when communicated by combining words when asked.

718E9800A19B4E188854539B19416B7B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.3 – Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective
choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully reading or listening.

2B849CE52C904194A11E1FABC69B1B1D.description: Demonstrate understanding of conventions of standard English within 4-5 conventions continuum when writing.

07A9CC6F41ED4CD0946D5780C7689D4B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.2 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when
writing; demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band conventions continuum.

DED86363339244698EC9913B59109B09.description: Demonstrate standard English grammar and usage within the 4-5 grammar continuum when writing or communicating.

4D5F577FADD644AD963BA9B3C7C134C3.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.1 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking;
demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band grammar continuum.

7536F04212E549F59874DE08E370BE85.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.6 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

2BAF32D208BE46A7A5F2A00228517C36.description: Select or create audio recordings and visual/tactile displays to enhance presentation.

52A482DCF20547B78FA842076BB727A3.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.5 – Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance
understanding of presentations.

4D55B9D97B2448959D10A00220418D20.description: Communicate opinion on a familiar topic or text, providing facts or details related to it.

C52C547C0C1E4FA397F1F8108E5FE760.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.4 – Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning
and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

FC5279F8F0704ECE8007C7C0470FDCDB.description: Identify the reasons and evidence supporting a specific point.

1605407EBA5C4134BADBC14AF4E279C2.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.3 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

55DFFDEA08C24570AB6DE136B0159761.description: Identify the explicitly stated main idea of text presented orally or through other media.

3BB4D2AAACC64F838287AD4F22F260F6.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.2 – Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively,
and orally.

249DF38300AE4A05985BA6FDA66F8405.description: Make comments that contribute to the discussion and link to the remarks of others.

920DB6732FDD4C48B6850C1C0B3FCEB9.description: Ask questions related to information in a discussion.

F946691ED0624910A30AB43563503DAC.description: Carry out assigned role in a discussion.

C83E0CFC05C24E27A8943DE9EE7AF057.description: Come to discussion prepared to share information.

B10945F273D44BC9937806D12792CBC4.description: Communicate with others in group interactions.

87A73C0A7F4040F1A911500AFD61ABF9.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.1 – Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners,
building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

A1C73284D3AF4D3281ED0701E94C60E1.description: Integrated into Standards W.1, W.2, and W.3

BA17CC01E86E4D97A391197A74CEFF90.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.10 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

8B10ACBF58174C0AB08C7562E2737E19.description: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

498614987CC34415BBA5B7D53CB36732.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.9 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research. Proposed: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

D51C842390674F7B8DB644ADAEBBD17B.description: Gather and sort relevant information on a topic from print or digital sources into given categories.

121469FF8E9C42CF9284C9B47F024354.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.6 (from Proposed Standards – was W.8 in 2010 Standards) – Gather relevant information from multiple print and
digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

975300C2528048968771C7FEE01D0B00.description: Conduct short research projects using two or more sources.

B928BBF6ECE1462592972E1B37AE8659.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.5 (from Proposed Standards – was W.7 in 2010 Standards) – Conduct short as well as more sustained research
projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

8C74E0670E7946BB84B6D2C60EB90CA6.description: With guidance and support from adults, use digital tools to produce writing while interacting and collaborating with others.

B542ADC8D13C446895BAF4BEA89B0258.description: CR Anchor Standard W.4: Use digital tools and resources to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

AED127DC92AF46549EC255D665E031B7.description: Write about an event of personal experience that includes three or more events in a sequence.

BA0CF959E0D24F9796663CB8E59D8A6F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.3 – Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen
details, and well-structured event sequences.

92E4E3ED57C0492DB6988F053B529EE1.description: Provide facts, details, or other information related to the topic.

DCCAB04BA82D4B9B809269C45ED6ED8E.description: Select a topic and write to convey information including related visual, tactual, or multimedia information as appropriate.

D9AC56E9F36D497B9B9BABE9A2282C2F.description: Write to share information supported by details.

D24F1C6CEA24487F8BA2790AACC9540E.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.2 – Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and
accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

B9A020FF61CB4819A66ABEE7EDFBC353.description: Provide reasons to support the opinion.

3D8E641E83AF4174B57B9B4DB3E4C694.description: Introduce the topic or text and state an opinion about it.

0D1D75770AE74FD096AAC6B952F0BF95.description: Write an opinion about topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons.

A5917EEAF02E448B8B78117DD155A99F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.1 – Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and
relevant and sufficient evidence.

D7CCFFD284294B3396BEA43E0DBC2FF5.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition when reading.

3ABF3D164004452ABDDE025E4D34691D.description: Read text comprised of familiar words with accuracy and understanding.

4D36CC7737D04AE2A041507AFA25F648.description: Engage in purposeful reading of text.

3B25E828336E4EF981989A90DFE7A8C3.description: Read common sight words and decode single syllable words.

2BC2AD384AF74BD0A0E4F4F93EE40C4D.description: Apply letter-sound knowledge to decode words."

77548C2E525747FD88CC14594D02F829.description: Purposefully selects or produces letters to create written documents."

C9F329A9718B44E8925F7555C8279696.description:
Actively engage in the reading of informational text for a clearly stated purpose and sustained periods of time. Connect prior knowledge and
experiences to text.

71C1BB959F4C43F2B41D120732D0A627.description:
CR Anchor Standard RI.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting prior
knowledge and experiences to text.

4042821919B04BCFA48811C1A4B4933C.description: Compare details presented in three or more texts on the same topic."

E2983CCC1B174C488829A94F6C33D4BB.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare
the approaches the authors take.

F1A91977A7EF4F0E9626E4C64E1916E1.description: Identify details and examples that supports specific points in a text.

104AD148742345C6B6A3FA4ED6489F97.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

CD2AF754D72645158FD6FD27B41CBAF8.description: Locate information in print or digital sources.

CC3EBDD123C046D39AAE0293E5DB9A0D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

D0E59C41E8E34CE78A81A11A206F2774.description: Compare two texts on the same topic.

F4E3E56989C54665ADF05C9EB8100E5E.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.6: Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

6EACF332845148148932E68877AE200E.description: Determine if a text tells about events, gives directions, or provides information on a topic.

83629A4221134929AE64068784FB747F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

9326CB1AB71F4A66A2F93C2F27B64525.description: Determine the meanings of domain-specific words and phrases.

7973DDC7BABD4D45A707EE7AEC9D95D1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning
or tone.

E6B942A8117744D3A43ABF3E927DFDC4.description: Compare two individuals, events, or ideas in an informational text.

62DF61E8ADBF44D9BB2C028CBF25A7CF.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.3 – Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

90FF856E9C0642AFA0292A74B0F0BC2C.description: Identify the main idea of a text when it is not explicitly stated.

2532D357E24B487F84832FB933499086.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.2 – Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

ABABDA3E1C42468CA5D2110C37B60E20.description: Identify words in the text to answer a question about explicit information.

5483ACA13E814EED9C4B0C6363146A67.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

A020024098F8493DAEA241617E0FAAEF.description: Actively engage in reading for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to text for sustained periods of time."

0E44429B16F94BC2BC170B2C4A63CF3D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting
prior knowledge and experiences to text.

6B2CDCE9419243E79E8B0000E3E520A0.description: Compare stories with similar topics or themes.

4EC06A997E34477092F02E07CE5C1960.description:
CCRAnchorStandardRL.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the
approaches the authors take.

51F6EC184EFA4E91B5823C57DA30D7D0.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

3636BE4585A545BDB05CAAE4A89EB4A8.description: Identify illustrations, tactual, or multimedia elements that add to understanding of a text.

1792E1AAFC454268A3E27A45C4CF1EA3.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

E999321E354F4E6BA0E182830713D379.description: Determine the point of view of the narrator.

DC896FA07D774E39AC32EC362684EA67.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.6 Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

857291B714FE479CB68E58B0E83F3BB4.description: Identify how a series of events fit together to create a particular story."

744577302F7A454E8C98130C6D778BF0.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

B7F76D6D9FE649F2AC2CF1E154A6626A.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text.

6FD8AF60F98E41908376E73CC86518BE.description: RL.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

4C2D41F5D90F4DCBABA1679C85512B91.description: Compare two characters in a familiar story.

7D282402F9634F50930D06EBB95E4F37.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.3 –Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

9C2206AA0EE64A98BA54DA47883ECBED.description: Identify the theme of a story, drama or poem.

188E0D6887CC48B8A7422F9734D0EA9C.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.2 –Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

81C9E8C4E0634299BFCBFCA518D7B56D.description: Identify words in the text that answer a question about explicit information.

C154409888B14D4C97397571461849F9.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
